result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (No Harm and Child < 6 Yrs or Disability)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Comply with court order in 22JC54. No use or possession of alcohol.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: 1:50 PM Defendant Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendant's right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds probable case and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of their bail conditions. Defendant orally confirms he has received date and time of hearing and confirms he will attend. Defendant provided notice.
$70 already posted. comply with court order in 22JC54, no use or possession of alcohol

1:50 PM Defendant Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified. Court quashes warrant based on appearance, questions non appearance. Attorney indicates was late yesterday but did call right away to appear. 
State requests $250 cash, not appearing to take matter seriously.
Court makes statements. 4th non appearance. 
Attorney Gramstrup argues not sure there are that many missed appearances, has maintained good contact. Could post $390.
Court orders $500 cash bond, will apply $70 already posted. $2000 signature bond continued. Conditions of comply with court order in 22JC54, no use or possession of alcohol. 

Arraignment scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.

9:15 AM Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen not in court. 
Att Gramstrup- no information
State requests warrant and bail forfeited, Wisconsin only
Court- defendant had notice, prior warrant. Orders warrant and bail forfeited.

10:30 defendant appears.
10:32 defendant leaves again
comply with court order in 22JC54, no use or possession of alcohol
comply with court order in 22JC54, no use or possession of alcohol

10:58 AM Defendant Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen in court.  Attorney Ryan Reid in court for Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court reviews file; quashes warrant, questions failure to appear.
Attorney Reid indicates that she was on her way and got stuck at a train.  Did come here but no one was on the bench and then had contact with the public defenders office. Overslept but did make phone calls to let people know where she was. Believes the State will be asking for reinstatement of signature bond.
State-fine with reinstating a signature bond if the court is ok with that.
Court cites concerns; court was on the bench all morning yesterday.
Attorney Reid clarifies that defendant contacted the COC and was told to come at 1:30 yesterday and she showed up at 1:40. 
Court questions ability to post; Attorney Reid states able to post $50-75.
Court reinstates signature bond and orders $70cb. with conditions: comply with court order in 22JC54, no use or possession of alcohol
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:32 PM Defendant Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen not in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen.  Prosecuting attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court orders warrant to continue based on non appearance of defendant.

9:03 AM Defendant Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen not in court.  Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes Attorney Gramstrup has been appointed but court informed him he did not need to appear but Ms. Allen was to appear. 
Court orders warrant and forfeiture. Wisconsin and Minnesota.

2:56 PM Defendant Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen in court.  Attorney Chad LaLor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Defendant indicates does not have counsel. Has been looking for private counsel. Will apply for public defender. Court notes matter pending for quite awhile. Questions why didn't apply sooner. 
State indicates they are set to go for preliminary hearing. 
Court does not reset preliminary hearing.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: comply with court order in 22JC54, no use or possession of alcohol

2:13 PM Defendant Willa Adrianne-Jean Allen in court.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address verified. Court recites charges against defendant and possible penalties. Defendant advised of right to consult an attorney. 
State requests 2000 signature bond, with condition of comply with court order in 22JC54, no consumption of alcohol
Court orders 2000 signature bond, with condition of comply with court order in 22JC54, no use or possession of alcohol
Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
